fields.Title of Presentation: A Rose by Any Other Name:  Sustainability Reporting and “Material” Information
fields.Conference/Meeting Name: Academy of Legal Studies in Business Annual Conference
fields.Sponsoring Organization: Academy of Legal Studies in Business
fields.Description/Abstract: Corporate reporting has historically focused on the disclosure of “material” information to shareholders.  The rise of sustainability reporting challenges the traditional definition of materiality by expanding the range of information users beyond shareholders.  However, the two dominant sustainability reporting frameworks – the Global Reporting Initiative (GRI) and the International Integrated Reporting framework (IIRC) – appear to differ in their definitions of this key concept.  The GRI framework explicitly includes “stakeholders” in its definition of materiality; the IIRC does not. This project investigates reports prepared under each of these frameworks to discern how reporters interpret the definitions and concept of “material” information.
